Row.Text: Can you conquer an empire worthy of Alexander the Great? Lasts no more than 60 Turns.

In this timed single-player scenario, you must rush to expand your empire to truly earn the title of "Alexander the Great." This scenario emphasizes combat, territorial expansion, and calculated use of the Great Generals who will fight by your side.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To win, conquer every city on the map within a number of turns determined by your difficulty level:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Settler: 60 turns[NEWLINE]Warlord or Chieftain: 55 turns[NEWLINE]King or Prince: 50 turns[NEWLINE]Immortal or Emperor: 45 turns[NEWLINE]Deity: 37 turns
From Greece to Egypt to India.

Settlers receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. All cities start with 2 [ICON_Citizen] Population and a Granary. District [ICON_Production] Production time is decreased and Encampments start with a Basilikoi Paides.
Start the game as suzerain of Athens, Marakanda, and Patala.
"I do not steal victory." —Alexander the Great
"There is nothing impossible to him who will try."
"I had rather excel others in the knowledge of what is excellent, than in the extent of my power and dominion."
"Know ye not that the end and object of conquest is to avoid doing the same thing as the conquered?"
"Holy shadows of the dead, I’m not to blame for your cruel and bitter fate."
